intro: Habranthus goianus, commonly known as the Goianus bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has strap-like leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in gardens, although it is not widely commercialized. The species is also noted for its ability to thrive in humid tropical climates.
